intro: Ceropegia heidukiae, commonly known as the Cape Flats ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its trailing stems and tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers a warm, dry climate. Its unique floral structure attracts specific pollinators, contributing to its ecological significance. Due to habitat loss, it is considered threatened and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
